Who is Francesca Orsini, JNU and London University scholar denied entry at Delhi airport?
description: Professor Francesca Orsini, a UK-based scholar of Hindi and Urdu literature at SOAS, University of London, was recently deported from Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International Airport over alleged visa violations. Holding a PhD from SOAS and a BA in Hindi from Venice University, Orsini has studied in India and taught at Cambridge. A Fellow of the British Academy, she specialises in multilingual literary cultures of South Asia and has authored several acclaimed academic works.

title: 'I have been critical of Modi because ... ' : Zohran Mamdani attends Diwali event in New York

Mamdani, running for New York City mayor, emphasizes his campaign's commitment to pluralism and representing all New Yorkers, regardless of their views on Modi.

Police have arrested the accused, Swami Kant, and are investigating the incident, which has sparked political outrage.

description: President Trump expressed a desire for amicable relations with China but criticized the nation's past trade practices, attributing them to a lack of business acumen in previous US leadership. He highlighted significant tariff revenues, suggesting potential distributions to citizens. Trump also indicated India has reduced Russian oil purchases, aligning with his desire for peace in Ukraine. A potential trade deal with China is anticipated at the upcoming APEC summit.

title: Trump pressured Zelenskyy to give up eastern Donbas in 'tense' meeting
description: A senior Ukrainian official revealed that President Trump urged President Zelenskyy to cede the Donbas region to Russia for peace during a tense meeting. Trump reportedly echoed Putin's talking points, warning Zelenskyy of annihilation if a deal wasn't struck. Zelenskyy left the White House without securing commitments, facing pressure for territorial concessions.

Liver damage warning signs visible on your hands; here’s what you need to know
description: Your hands can offer early warnings of liver trouble. Look for red palms, changes in nails like brittleness or white tips, and persistent itching. These subtle signs, including tremors and bent fingers, may point to conditions like fatty liver or cirrhosis. Prompt medical attention for these hand symptoms is crucial for effective management and preventing serious liver disease.

Delhi had a blast: In Karol Bagh, it was a scream! Stations exceeded standard decibel levels
description: Delhi's Diwali festivities ringing in this year brought an unexpected surge of noise, with several monitoring stations recording decibel levels well beyond what is legally acceptable. Even with a green cracker initiative and allotted hours for bursting, the decibel meter was pushed to its limits, particularly from 9 pm until 11 pm, spilling over into the night across many regions.

title: H-1B fears cool, companies hiring from US campuses to gain
Delhi air pollution: At peak hours, data goes blank at many stations
description: Air quality monitoring stations in Delhi experienced significant data gaps during peak pollution hours, with several stations going offline when PM2.5 and PM10 levels neared 1,000 µg/m³. Experts allege this skews 24-hour averages and hinders understanding of pollution's impact. Authorities, however, deny any missing data.

title: Delhi air pollution: Worst Diwali air in 4 years, Tuesday winds prevent ‘severe’ drop
description: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category on Diwali night as firecracker violations surged, pushing PM2.5 levels to their highest since 2021. Despite a temporary spike, rising winds and warmer temperatures prevented a prolonged severe episode. Authorities are monitoring the situation, with Stage III of GRAP not yet invoked.

title: Why global apps showed Delhi’s AQI levels at 2,000+, but CPCB under 400
description: Delhi residents were confused by vastly different pollution readings on Tuesday. While India's CPCB showed AQI below 400, international apps like IQAir reported over 2,000. Experts explain these discrepancies stem from different calculation methods and data sources, though both indicate dangerously poor air quality post-Diwali.
